programme.title: Inferno
Inferno
programme.desc:
Inferno: Directed by Ron Howard. With Tom Hanks, Felicity Jones, Omar Sy, Irrfan Khan. When Robert Langdon wakes up in an Italian hospital with amnesia, he teams up with Dr. Sienna Brooks, and together they must race across Europe against the clock to foil a deadly global plot." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3062096/","name":"Inferno","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzNTE2NTkzMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAzOTUyMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Robert Langdon wakes up in an Italian hospital with amnesia, he teams up with Dr. Sienna Brooks, and together they must race across Europe against the clock to foil a deadly global plot.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3062096/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"claudio_carvalho"},"dateCreated":"2016-12-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Disappointing and Predictable Story","reviewBody":"The geneticist Bertrand Zobrist (Ben Foster) is hunted down by three men and commits suicide from the top of a tower in Florence. Zobrist believes that the Earth's population that has an exponential growth should be reduced in 50% to save the other 50%. In Florence, Professor Robert Langdon (Tom Hanks) awakens in a hospital with no memory of the last two days and with daydreams and dreadful visions. Dr. Sienna Brooks (Felicity Jones) explains that he has a head trauma cause by a bullet that scratched his head and he would recover his memory in a few days. Out of the blue, a doctor tells that the police wants to interrogate him and a police officer, who is indeed the killer Vayentha (Ana Ularu), shoots the doctor but Sienna and Langdon succeeds to escape to her apartment. Langdon finds a Faraday pointer in the pocket of his jacket and when they project the image, they see the Map of Dante's Inferno by Sandro Botticelli. They contact the American Consulate but give the wrong address nearby the apartment. Soon the area is under siege of the World Health Organization (WHO) agents and the local police, including Vayentha, and Langdon and Sienna conclude that Zobrist has created a virus to annihilate the world's population. But who can be trusted?

"Inferno" completes the trilogy of Dan Brown based on the adventures of Professor Robert Langdon with a totally disappointing and predictable story. The screenplay is a mess and the camera work and edition are awful. Robert Langdon is a superman since he is wounded and with amnesia, but capable of run, jump over the walls, recalls details such as hidden passages and door in different locations etc. The plot point with Sienna Brooks is totally predictable and it was obvious that she had teamed up with Langdon to find where the virus is. The romance between Langdon and Elizabeth Sinskey, performed by the unknown Sidse Babett Knudsen, has no chemistry. In the end, "Inferno" is absolutely forgettable. My vote is five.

programme.title: This Is the End
To już jest koniec
This Is The End
programme.desc:
This Is the End: Directed by Evan Goldberg, Seth Rogen. With James Franco, Jonah Hill, Seth Rogen, Jay Baruchel. Six Los Angeles celebrities are stuck in James Franco's house after a series of devastating events just destroyed the city. Inside, the group not only have to face the apocalypse, but themselves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1245492/","name":"This Is the End","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxODE3NjM1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzkzNjc4OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six Los Angeles celebrities are stuck in James Franco's house after a series of devastating events just destroyed the city. Inside, the group not only have to face the apocalypse, but themselves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1245492/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Ric-7"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A devil put aside for me","reviewBody":"I thoroughly enjoyed the film, though in retrospect, I am not sure if it is really a great film--there's not much to compare it to. One thing's for certain: this film is not "just like" any other film you could name. It is one of the funniest films I have seen in quite a while. And I am probably going to miss the Rapture as a result of my enjoyment.

The film has graphic sex talk and graphic violence. The dialog could hardly be any nastier. And of course, hardly more sacrilegious. However, despite all of that, the film is surprisingly good-natured.

This is not a film for children or for family viewing. Anyone who is squeamish or easily offended should stay away.

And don't automatically assume that anyone over 40 would not like this film. I'm over 60; I had a great time. So I saw it a second time, and loved it even more.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":399178,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2013-09-11","keywords":"apocalypse,ensemble cast,actress playing herself,actor playing himself,male friendship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Green Band Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi166438425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNjI0ODE3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzExMjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNjI0ODE3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzExMjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six friends become trapped in a house after a series of strange and catastrophic events devastate Los Angeles. As the world unravels outside, dwindling supplies and cabin fever threaten to tear apart the friendships inside. Eventually, they are forced to leave the house, facing their fate and the true meaning of friendship and redemption. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1698571/","name":"Evan Goldberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0345956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142446/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0736622/","name":"Seth Rogen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1698571/","name":"Evan Goldberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1083540/","name":"Jason Stone"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

One thing's for certain: this film is not "just like" any other film you could name. It is one of the funniest films I have seen in quite a while. And I am probably going to miss the Rapture as a result of my enjoyment.

The film has graphic sex talk and graphic violence. The dialog could hardly be any nastier. And of course, hardly more sacrilegious. However, despite all of that, the film is surprisingly good-natured.

This is not a film for children or for family viewing. Anyone who is squeamish or easily offended should stay away.

And don't automatically assume that anyone over 40 would not like this film. I'm over 60; I had a great time. So I saw it a second time, and loved it even more.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":399178,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2013-09-11","keywords":"apocalypse,ensemble cast,actress playing herself,actor playing himself,male friendship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Green Band Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi166438425","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNjI0ODE3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzExMjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNjI0ODE3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzExMjkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Six friends become trapped in a house after a series of strange and catastrophic events devastate Los Angeles. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
Jumanji: Przygoda w dżungli
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
programme.desc:
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle: Directed by Jake Kasdan. With Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Jack Black, Karen Gillan. Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2283362/","name":"Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ0NDhjYWItYTMxZi00NTk2LWIzNDEtOWZiYWYxZjc2MTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2283362/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jared_Andrews"},"dateCreated":"2018-01-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"This Movie is Pure Fun!","reviewBody":"The steady and impressive box office success is well-deserved. This movie is pure fun! Actually, it's more than fun; it's clever and perfectly 2018. 

 No one plays board games anymore, so what did the filmmakers do? They changed Jumanji into a video game. Simple, yet smart. This change not only made sense, it also opened the doors for the characters to possess and exhibit wildly over-the-top skills and physical abilities that would only make sense in a video game setting. 

 Also perfectly 2018, the handling of Karen Gillan's short shorts. The film earnestly attempts to comment on how video games exploit female characters in blatantly sexual ways. "Why am I wearing short shorts in the jungle?!" she exclaims. This scene is well done and could have made a worthy statement if the movie did not proceed to display her booty in the short shorts at multiple junctures throughout the film. The intentions were good; the execution, not so much.

 Gillan plays a powerful female badass exceptionally well. She even nails the necessary nuances required in playing a shy, unconfident student who is merely inhabiting the avatar of the female badass. Each star in the movie plays the embodiment of an avatar assumed by the high school kids after they are sucked into the Jumanji video game. I understand that the last sentence sounds ridiculous. That's Jumanji. You have to tolerate a bit of ridiculous. Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, and Jack Black all deliver in their roles. Hart is hilarious. Black reminds us that he is still funny. Jack Black should be in more funny movies. Johnson is equal parts funny and charming to such an obscene level that it almost doesn't make sense. He's at the point now that he can still be wonderful and charming, even if the movie around him falls woefully flat (shout out to Baywatch).

 Setting much of the film in a video game also excused an exceedingly simple plot. The movie embraces this. With all the funny lines, the best one comes when at one point someone asks a video game character in a car "why can't you just drive us where we need to go?" At that moment I realized that this movie knows exactly what it is.

 Still, the movie is not perfect. Bobby Canavale's villain character is strange in a strange way, rather than strange in a cool way. The dialogue has its flaws too. At one point, Jack Black's character gives a pep talk to Karen Gillan's character about confidence. At first, it seems like a lovely speech that tells a teenage girl that she has value because of who she is as a person. Then it abruptly ends with "I'm just saying you're a babe." Oh, so physical attractiveness is what gives her value? Ugh. Once again, they were so close to delivering a worthwhile message, but fell just short.

 These faults are only slight hiccups. Most viewers probably will barely notice them. They certainly didn't ruin my enjoyment of the movie. Above all else, the movie is about fun. And on that aspect, it comes through with flying colors.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":352586,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-12-20","keywords":"jungle,trapped in a game,title based on song,song in title,high school","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3413817625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUxNzE5MDI1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAwNzE2MzI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUxNzE5MDI1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAwNzE2MzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four teenagers discover an old video game console and are literally drawn into the game's jungle setting becoming the adult avatars they choose."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2394794/","name":"Karen Gillan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0366389/","name":"Kevin Hart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440458/","name":"Jake Kasdan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332017/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571344/","name":"Chris McKenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273099/","name":"Erik Sommers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003298/","name":"Scott Rosenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2283362, Title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, --- Description: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle: Directed by Jake Kasdan. With Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Jack Black, Karen Gillan. Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2283362/","name":"Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ0NDhjYWItYTMxZi00NTk2LWIzNDEtOWZiYWYxZjc2MTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2283362/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Jared_Andrews","dateCreated":"2018-01-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"This Movie is Pure Fun!","reviewBody":"The steady and impressive box office success is well-deserved. This movie is pure fun! Actually, it's more than fun; it's clever and perfectly 2018. 

 No one plays board games anymore, so what did the filmmakers do? They changed Jumanji into a video game. Simple, yet smart. This change not only made sense, it also opened the doors for the characters to possess and exhibit wildly over-the-top skills and physical abilities that would only make sense in a video game setting. 

 Also perfectly 2018, the handling of Karen Gillan's short shorts. The film earnestly attempts to comment on how video games exploit female characters in blatantly sexual ways. "Why am I wearing short shorts in the jungle?!" she exclaims. This scene is well done and could have made a worthy statement if the movie did not proceed to display her booty in the short shorts at multiple junctures throughout the film. The intentions were good; the execution, not so much.

 Gillan plays a powerful female badass exceptionally well. She even nails the necessary nuances required in playing a shy, unconfident student who is merely inhabiting the avatar of the female badass. Each star in the movie plays the embodiment of an avatar assumed by the high school kids after they are sucked into the Jumanji video game. I understand that the last sentence sounds ridiculous. That's Jumanji. You have to tolerate a bit of ridiculous. Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, and Jack Black all deliver in their roles. Hart is hilarious. Black reminds us that he is still funny. Jack Black should be in more funny movies. Johnson is equal parts funny and charming to such an obscene level that it almost doesn't make sense. He's at the point now that he can still be wonderful and charming, even if the movie around him falls woefully flat (shout out to Baywatch).

 Setting much of the film in a video game also excused an exceedingly simple plot. The movie embraces this. With all the funny lines, the best one comes when at one point someone asks a video game character in a car "why can't you just drive us where we need to go?" At that moment I realized that this movie knows exactly what it is.

 Still, the movie is not perfect. Bobby Canavale's villain character is strange in a strange way, rather than strange in a cool way. The dialogue has its flaws too. At one point, Jack Black's character gives a pep talk to Karen Gillan's character about confidence. At first, it seems like a lovely speech that tells a teenage girl that she has value because of who she is as a person. Then it abruptly ends with "I'm just saying you're a babe." Oh, so physical attractiveness is what gives her value? Ugh. Once again, they were so close to delivering a worthwhile message, but fell just short.

 These faults are only slight hiccups. Most viewers probably will barely notice them. They certainly didn't ruin my enjoyment of the movie. Above all else, the movie is about fun. And on that aspect, it comes through with flying colors.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":352586,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-12-20","keywords":"jungle,trapped in a game,title based on song,song in title,high school","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3413817625","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUxNzE5MDI1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAwNzE2MzI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUxNzE5MDI1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAwNzE2MzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four teenagers discover an old video game console and are literally drawn into the game's jungle setting becoming the adult avatars they choose.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2394794/","name":"Karen Gillan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0366389/","name":"Kevin Hart"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440458/","name":"Jake Kasdan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332017/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571344/","name":"Chris McKenna","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273099/","name":"Erik Sommers","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003298/","name":"Scott Rosenberg"],"duration":"PT1H59M"</script><metacontent="

A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2543164/","name":"Arrival","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMzU0ODcxNDheQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDE1OTI4MzAy._V1_.jpg","description":"A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2543164/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent, intelligent, just a terrific film.","reviewBody":"This is a very, very well made film, which is thought provoking, measured, engaging, and thoroughly well made.

There is nothing brash, or heavy handed about it, the story is superbly told, with well grounded characters. The story is of course sci fi, and hugely creative, but it's never silly, it is incredibly intelligent.

Awesome special effects, I loved the design of the alien race, and their language, quite incredible.

A story of hope, which I loved. 9/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":652241,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-11-11","keywords":"alien contact,linguistics,linguist,nonlinear timeline,based on short story","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4225807897","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4Mzg5OTY5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDk4ODg0MDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4Mzg5OTY5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDk4ODg0MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A linguist is recruited by the military to assist in translating alien communications."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010736/","name":"Amy Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0719637/","name":"Jeremy Renner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001845/","name":"Forest Whitaker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0898288/","name":"Denis Villeneuve"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296971/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158853/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2104063/","name":"Eric Heisserer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5384213/","name":"Ted Chiang"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
Bez litości 2
The Equalizer 2
programme.desc:
The Equalizer 2: Directed by Antoine Fuqua. With Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal, Ashton Sanders, Orson Bean. Robert McCall serves an unflinching justice for the exploited and oppressed, but how far will he go when that is someone he loves?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3766354/","name":"The Equalizer 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2OTYzODQyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjU3Njk5NTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Robert McCall serves an unflinching justice for the exploited and oppressed, but how far will he go when that is someone he loves?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3766354/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bastille-852-731547"},"dateCreated":"2018-07-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Denzel Delivers A Solid, If Unspectacular, Follow-Up","reviewBody":"I'm a fan of Denzel Washington and enjoyed the first "Equalizer" movie. That said, "The Equalizer" was not a film I was necessarily clamoring for a sequel to--although I still was looking forward to it since Denzel Washington and the action scenes in the trailer would be worthwhile. After seeing "The Equalizer 2" at an advance screening, I can say that while the film is not perfect, it's an entertaining ride for adult action junkies that is on par with the first movie in terms of quality.

Denzel returns as Robert McCall, a vigilante-type figure and former special forces operative who begins the movie on a mission in Turkey. After such prologue, the film centers in on its primary narrative thread: a woman who he worked with on multiple missions has been killed by thugs in Brussels. The rest of the film primarily concerns McCall's attempt to bring the perpetrators of such heinous crime to justice, although the film also contains multiple sub-plots--including a new, older adolescent-age character who could theoretically become somewhat of a protégé to McCall in a possible third movie in the franchise.

The action scenes in "The Equalizer 2" are thrilling and intense. Sometimes the intersection of Fuqua's cinematography choices and sound edits can feel and appear a bit choppy at times, but the film certainly brings the white-knuckle goods. The film's action-packed finale scene, a climatic showdown in the midst of an incredibly rough hurricane, is thoroughly effective and satisfying. Just like the first movie, the violence in "The Equalizer 2" certainly earns its R rating. Denzel Washington is great as McCall, blending a unique mix of charisma and ferocity. Just like in the first movie, he is able to carry the film on all of its levels from beginning to end. That said, the film does have one large flaw--that of which the story is highly predictable. If you've seen any other "vigilante"-style action movie before, you'll be able to guess the key plot elements well before they unfold, and the film's sole attempt at a plot twist can be guessed within the first 20 minutes of the movie. 

Fans of the first movie and Denzel Washington should be able to look past such banality and enjoy the action-packed ride, and I do recommend the film to them. 7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148845,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-07-20","keywords":"brussels belgium,woman fights a man,gun,returning character killed off,gunfight","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1943583513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGVkNmVjOTktNjM1MS00MTI1LWI3NDYtYzc5MDAwNjhjOGRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGVkNmVjOTktNjM1MS00MTI1LWI3NDYtYzc5MDAwNjhjOGRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Robert McCall serves an unflinching justice for the exploited and oppressed, but how far will he go when that is someone he loves?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000243/","name":"Denzel Washington"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050959/","name":"Pedro Pascal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5480894/","name":"Ashton Sanders"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0298807/","name":"Antoine Fuqua"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0921013/","name":"Richard Wenk"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0805994/","name":"Michael Sloan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2030456/","name":"Richard Lindheim"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

That said, "The Equalizer" was not a film I was necessarily clamoring for a sequel to--although I still was looking forward to it since Denzel Washington and the action scenes in the trailer would be worthwhile. After seeing "The Equalizer 2" at an advance screening, I can say that while the film is not perfect, it's an entertaining ride for adult action junkies that is on par with the first movie in terms of quality.

Denzel returns as Robert McCall, a vigilante-type figure and former special forces operative who begins the movie on a mission in Turkey. After such prologue, the film centers in on its primary narrative thread: a woman who he worked with on multiple missions has been killed by thugs in Brussels. The rest of the film primarily concerns McCall's attempt to bring the perpetrators of such heinous crime to justice, although the film also contains multiple sub-plots--including a new, older adolescent-age character who could theoretically become somewhat of a protégé to McCall in a possible third movie in the franchise.

The action scenes in "The Equalizer 2" are thrilling and intense. Sometimes the intersection of Fuqua's cinematography choices and sound edits can feel and appear a bit choppy at times, but the film certainly brings the white-knuckle goods. The film's action-packed finale scene, a climatic showdown in the midst of an incredibly rough hurricane, is thoroughly effective and satisfying. Just like the first movie, the violence in "The Equalizer 2" certainly earns its R rating. Denzel Washington is great as McCall, blending a unique mix of charisma and ferocity. Just like in the first movie, he is able to carry the film on all of its levels from beginning to end. That said, the film does have one large flaw--that of which the story is highly predictable. If you've seen any other "vigilante"-style action movie before, you'll be able to guess the key plot elements well before they unfold, and the film's sole attempt at a plot twist can be guessed within the first 20 minutes of the movie. 

Fans of the first movie and Denzel Washington should be able to look past such banality and enjoy the action-packed ride, and I do recommend the film to them. 7/10","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148845,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2018-07-20","keywords":"brussels belgium,woman fights a man,gun,returning character killed off,gunfight","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1943583513","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGVkNmVjOTktNjM1MS00MTI1LWI3NDYtYzc5MDAwNjhjOGRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGVkNmVjOTktNjM1MS00MTI1LWI3NDYtYzc5MDAwNjhjOGRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Robert McCall serves an unflinching justice for the exploited and oppressed, but how far will he go when that is someone he loves?","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000243/","name":"Denzel Washington","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0050959/","name":"Pedro Pascal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5480894/","name":"Ashton Sanders"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0298807/","name":"Antoine Fuqua"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0152181/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0921013/","name":"Richard Wenk","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0805994/","name":"Michael Sloan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2030456/","name":"Richard Lindheim"],"duration":"PT2H1M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Burden of Truth
programme.desc: Burden of Truth: Created by Brad Simpson. With Kristin Kreuk, Peter Mooney, Meegwun Fairbrother, Anwen O'Driscoll. Big city lawyer Joanna Hanley returns to her hometown to take the case of a group of girls suffering from a mysterious illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6987476/","name":"Burden of Truth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWNiNTEyZmYtODIzMy00NmEzLTk4MmYtYTg4ZTc0MzJiOTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjYzNDE4ODA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Big city lawyer Joanna Hanley returns to her hometown to take the case of a group of girls suffering from a mysterious illness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6987476/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Bobonthecouch"},"dateCreated":"2018-10-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pretty good show but...","reviewBody":"The story lines are intriguing and the acting is pretty good. I want to give it a higher rating because at the end of each episode I've looked forward to the next one; However, the lack of logic and common sense (particularly in the earlier episodes) as well as continuity issues prevents me from doing so. The yo-yo effect of both main characters' commitment to the case, the unrealistic reactions by some of the characters in some instances and the confusing timeline references distract me from what would otherwise be a thoroughly enjoyable viewing experience. I have the season 1 finale to watch yet and I believe the show has been picked up for a second season so I will look forward to that. I hope some of the flaws will be addressed for series 2 but, I also hope the overall look and feel won't be drastically altered. Some shows in the past have been tweaked into nonexistence by network brass and viewer opinions. This first season seemed to be generally headed in the right direction. "Burden of Truth" could have a long run if handled properly.\n\nAddendum: The way I rate shows... I don't usually review anything less than a 7 because 6 would be a failing grade and I won't waste my time watching it. I'm old; I don't know how much time I've got left. Since I probably turned it off before getting even halfway through, it wouldn't be fair to rate or review it. 7 is watchable but I may go a while between episodes since, though somewhat entertaining, there are other shows more interesting or compelling. 8 would be a regular in my lineup. 9 is a must see and probably bingeable. 10 is just the epitome of superbity and headed for my all-time favorites list. I'm adding this to my reviews because it seems there are a lot of binary reactions to pretty much everything these days. I am not a like/unlike kind of guy. I see a lot of grays so if I give something a 10 it doesn't mean the only alternative is a 1.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3867,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-01-10","keywords":"legal drama,attorney,court case,legal system,female protagonist","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0471036/","name":"Kristin Kreuk"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1312105/","name":"Peter Mooney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2868495/","name":"Meegwun Fairbrother"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121071/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0466443/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800920/","name":"Brad Simpson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":""Off the Field" Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1975630617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NGViZWMtMzE0MS00MTI1LTg4YzAtNjdmYzcxMzFjYzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5NGViZWMtMzE0MS00MTI1LTg4YzAtNjdmYzcxMzFjYzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"When it's suspected that her big-pharma client's vaccine has caused a mysterious illness affecting a handful of teenaged girls, high-powered attorney Joanna Hanley (Kristin Kreuk) returns to her hometown of Millwood to quickly and quietly settle the case."}}</script><metacontent="

I want to give it a higher rating because at the end of each episode I've looked forward to the next one; However, the lack of logic and common sense (particularly in the earlier episodes) as well as continuity issues prevents me from doing so. The yo-yo effect of both main characters' commitment to the case, the unrealistic reactions by some of the characters in some instances and the confusing timeline references distract me from what would otherwise be a thoroughly enjoyable viewing experience. I have the season 1 finale to watch yet and I believe the show has been picked up for a second season so I will look forward to that. I hope some of the flaws will be addressed for series 2 but, I also hope the overall look and feel won't be drastically altered. Some shows in the past have been tweaked into nonexistence by network brass and viewer opinions. This first season seemed to be generally headed in the right direction. "Burden of Truth" could have a long run if handled properly.\n\nAddendum: The way I rate shows... I don't usually review anything less than a 7 because 6 would be a failing grade and I won't waste my time watching it. I'm old; I don't know how much time I've got left. Since I probably turned it off before getting even halfway through, it wouldn't be fair to rate or review it. 7 is watchable but I may go a while between episodes since, though somewhat entertaining, there are other shows more interesting or compelling. 8 would be a regular in my lineup. 9 is a must see and probably bingeable. 10 is just the epitome of superbity and headed for my all-time favorites list. I'm adding this to my reviews because it seems there are a lot of binary reactions to pretty much everything these days. I am not a like/unlike kind of guy. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. programme.desc: Profilage: Created by Fanny Robert, Sophie Lebarbier. With Jean-Michel Martial, Raphaël Ferret, Philippe Bas, Valérie Dashwood. Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. She's very sweet, she wears very colored clothes and a huge yellow bag. She looks like a little girl who needs a doll, but she's very smart and a very good profiler. Step by step, she fits in the team and her colleagues, very reserved at first, become her best friends." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1418572/","name":"Profilage","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWY0ZmE1ZWQtNjEzNy00YWE0LTkzOTgtNjc3MjQ2NWQ4YzYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTI2OTA2NTEw._V1_.jpg","description":"Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. programme.desc: NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service: Created by Donald P. Bellisario, Don McGill. With Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Sean Murray, Pauley Perrette. The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk","dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 7242816, Title: Harrow, --- Description: Harrow: Created by Stephen M. Irwin, Leigh McGrath. With Ioan Gruffudd, Darren Gilshenan, Damien Garvey, Ella Newton. Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt7242816/","name":"Harrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MzczNjMwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDcxMTE4NDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Harrow tells the story of Dr. Daniel Harrow, a forensic pathologist with a total disregard for authority.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7242816/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"oliviamteller","dateCreated":"2018-03-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"More please.","reviewBody":"While I can't speak to the authenticity of Australian location portrayal, as other reviewers have, I think the show was great. Acting, camera work, jokes, and banter between coworkers, all served to create a believable environment. And that dark past of his, just waiting to be revealed and possibly destroy everything, hovers in the background, creating tension. I find myself waiting for the next episode. One reviewer complains about there being a personal story behind the main character, but that's how we end up finding out about that mysterious past of his. And, seriously, what do they want? A cardboard cutout character with minimal lines and no home life? The added drama keeps the show interesting, adds extra levels to the character as it goes, and family members are always potentially at risk when there's a hero character involved, so there's that. Give the show a chance and don't pay attention to bad reviews if you already think you might like something.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7057,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2018-03-09","keywords":"doctor,caucasian,latex gloves,forensic pathologist,dead body","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344435/","name":"Ioan Gruffudd","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319696/","name":"Darren Gilshenan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0960946/","name":"Damien Garvey"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110425/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2207641/","name":"Stephen M. Irwin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0569838/","name":"Leigh McGrath"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Harrow","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi709605401","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjZmNjEtMTY1Ni00YjY5LTgwNzItMzNlMDU0YjFlNWEwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ioan Gruffudd stars as Daniel Harrow, a brilliant forensic pathologist who solves the cases others can't. #HarrowABC"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Profilage: Created by Fanny Robert, Sophie Lebarbier. With Jean-Michel Martial, Raphaël Ferret, Philippe Bas, Valérie Dashwood. Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. She's very sweet, she wears very colored clothes and a huge yellow bag. She looks like a little girl who needs a doll, but she's very smart and a very good profiler. Step by step, she fits in the team and her colleagues, very reserved at first, become her best friends." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1418572/","name":"Profilage","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWY0ZmE1ZWQtNjEzNy00YWE0LTkzOTgtNjc3MjQ2NWQ4YzYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTI2OTA2NTEw._V1_.jpg","description":"Chloé Saint-Laurent is a profiler and works with a police team to solve murders in Paris. She's very sweet, she wears very colored clothes and a huge yellow bag. She looks like a little girl who needs a doll, but she's very smart and","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1418572/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ndasny"},"dateCreated":"2021-12-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"nice combination of procedural and personal","reviewBody":"I'm a fan of procedural so initially I wasn't into the substantial focus on the team's personal dramas. The lead Chloe was unbelievable, annoying and distracting but they play down her flakeyness and she's more mature by season 3. All the actors, including the actor playing Chloe, do an excellent job. The setting is lovely. It's engaging without being gripping (which is good if you're not looking for gripping). programme.title: The Shield
The Shield
Świat gliniarzy
The Shield
programme.desc: The Shield: Created by Shawn Ryan. With Michael Chiklis, Michael Jace, Jay Karnes, CCH Pounder. Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire. I want to compare both shows and see which one is better.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":77198,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.7},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2002-03-12","keywords":"corrupt cop,los angeles california,made for cable tv,mayor,drugs","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004821/","name":"Michael Chiklis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413052/","name":"Michael Jace"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0439813/","name":"Jay Karnes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0203234/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752841/","name":"Shawn Ryan"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Shield: Season Seven","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi425591577","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home video trailer for the final season of this cop show"}}</script><metacontent="

Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto","dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire. programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0286486, Title: The Shield, --- Description: The Shield: Created by Shawn Ryan. With Michael Chiklis, Michael Jace, Jay Karnes, CCH Pounder. Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto","dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire. I want to compare both shows and see which one is better.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":77198,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.7,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2002-03-12","keywords":"corrupt cop,los angeles california,made for cable tv,mayor,drugs","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004821/","name":"Michael Chiklis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0413052/","name":"Michael Jace","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0439813/","name":"Jay Karnes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0203234/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752841/","name":"Shawn Ryan"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Shield: Season Seven","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi425591577","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1NjYxNjgtYmIzYy00ZmUzLTllNjMtMzA3MDMwMDAxZmQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home video trailer for the final season of this cop show"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
Koszmar minionego lata
I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: I Know What You Did Last Summer: Directed by Jim Gillespie. With Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr.. Four young friends bound by a tragic accident are reunited when they find themselves being stalked by a hook-wielding maniac in their small seaside town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119345/","name":"I Know What You Did Last Summer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI4ODJlNGUtNjFiMy00ODgzLWIzYjgtMzgyZTljZDQ2NGZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young friends bound by a tragic accident are reunited when they find themselves being stalked by a hook-wielding maniac in their small seaside town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119345/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lukem-52760"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"A 90's SLASHER CLASSIC!!!","reviewBody":"I grew up watching all those AWESOME 90's slasher films after Scream started the new wave of slasher Thrillers & i loved those times of the 90's in my teens & couldn't wait for the next Horror hit & I know what you did last summer (1997) was a massive blockbuster hit & a Nostalgic classic of mine. This is one of my favourites of those 90's slasher flicks, i love the cast & the BRILLIANT atmosphere & music & the excellent small fishing town location setting!!! The movie has a darkness to it,a real sense of dread & with the old worn down looking fishing town makes this a great slasher,the setting is beautiful & similar to the little fishing coastal town in the Fog (1980) so that's a very good thing!!! Ben Willis is a scary killer too & very iconic & memorable with his wet looking fisherman coat & hook!!! Very cool & menacing looking. Yeah this movie was a huge summer hit & when i finally brought it on video i loved it & watched it many times on a summer night, a perfect summer time slasher & one of the best made & actually a very well acted proper Thriller with real drama & characters within the slasher parts & that's why this stands up way above most of the rest of the 90's slasher wave, but i think Robert Rodriguez's The Faculty is the best of those. This was made to be very good & not just another teen killer flick. Last summer also stands out for having real serious drama & sense of threat,you really feel for the damaged characters & their lives!!! Other good 90's slashers are of course Scream & Scream 2,The Faculty, Halloween H20 & Urban Legend these stood out as excellent well made slasher films & are all great","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":141348,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1997-10-17","keywords":"stupid victim,taking a shower,mystery killer,characters murdered one by one,part of trilogy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"I Know What You Did Last Summer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi663666457","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMDBiYmQtZDJkNC00NjQxLTlkZWEtMzMyN2RkOTBkY2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMDBiYmQtZDJkNC00NjQxLTlkZWEtMzMyN2RkOTBkY2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001349/","name":"Jennifer Love Hewitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001264/","name":"Sarah Michelle Gellar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000162/","name":"Anne Heche"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318947/","name":"Jim Gillespie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033437/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147895/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0242028/","name":"Lois Duncan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0932078/","name":"Kevin Williamson"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I'll Always Know What You Did Last Summer

I'll Always Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: I'll Always Know What You Did Last Summer: Directed by Sylvain White. With Brooke Nevin, David Paetkau, Torrey DeVitto, Ben Easter. A group of teenagers in Colorado find themselves being stalked and killed one by one by a mysterious figure with a hook, exactly one year after they covered up a friend's accidental death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0469111/","name":"I'll Always Know What You Did Last Summer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVlMDViZTgtMTUxNi00ZTcyLWJkZDAtZDI3NjQ0M2JjM2U3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of teenagers in Colorado find themselves being stalked and killed one by one by a mysterious figure with a hook, exactly one year after they covered up a friend's accidental death.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0469111/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kirpianuscus"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"the worst","reviewBody":"It is final part of a serie. The references, the stories about origin are present and it is just unrealistic to define it only as a horror flick. The good point, saving part of it is the photography, just inspired. The story, the actors ... The effort and the good intentions are obvious but far to be enough. So, few kids, a joke and the terrible consequences. Nothing new. Only too...formal."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11553,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2006-08-22","keywords":"cleavage,colorado,bikini,scantily clad female,slasher","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"I'll Always Know What You Did Last Summer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2427322649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWVkM2U2OTktZWI2MC00ZDZkLWIyNzctNDU2YjkzMjg5NjI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWVkM2U2OTktZWI2MC00ZDZkLWIyNzctNDU2YjkzMjg5NjI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Screen Gems"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627492/","name":"Brooke Nevin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0655959/","name":"David Paetkau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1722914/","name":"Torrey DeVitto"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1234893/","name":"Sylvain White"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017834/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0242028/","name":"Lois Duncan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919115/","name":"Michael D. programme.desc: The Shield: Created by Shawn Ryan. With Michael Chiklis, Michael Jace, Jay Karnes, CCH Pounder. Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire. Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0286486/","name":"The Shield","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNzQwODI5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxMjI5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows the lives and cases of a dirty Los Angeles Police Department cop and the unit under his command.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0286486/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"danielcereto","dateCreated":"2020-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Shield on 2020","reviewBody":"I just finished this series today on July 2020 and all I have to say is that it does not look cheap, old or non interesting, just keeping in mind this was filmed between 2002-2008. First, most of the main cast are extremely good actors. Vic, Aceveda and Shane were the most powerful. Second, the storyline and the length of the chapters are quite good too. Probably the story could have been told with 4-5 seasons easily. But it is what it is. Last, camera work, make up and sound are pretty cool. I can't believe this show started on 2002. On the other hand, seems some characters were not fully developed or look like the writers didn't want to give them credit. But not a big thing. So, overall if you're looking for an excellent cops show, brutal, raw and almost perfect, this one is for you. Now, I'm going to watch The Wire.
