With David Morrissey, Eleanor Worthington-Cox, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Liana Cornell. In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5932548/","name":"Britannia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmM2ZjA1NTAtZTBkNi00YmY2LTlhODItNWRlMmIxMzZjMjY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjkwOTAyMDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5932548/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jaybizman","dateCreated":"2020-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a look - First Series was, IMO, the best...","reviewBody":"I'll admit I love watching anything to do with Ancient Rome. As a teenager, I studied Lingua Latina and translated, for example, the writings of Julius Caesar and all the exploits throughout his career.

The Roman Army around 43AD was the most dangerous and skilled in the World; and Ancient Rome ruled most of what was the known World, they may lose a battle here and there, but rarely lost a war.

After every battle a Legions Commander would write about both his and the enemies tactics, and send a dispatch to the Sergeant Major Of The Army, back in Rome - who would copy same, and send it to every other Roman Legion General. This way every Commander had full knowledge of the enemy. And it worked.

Britannia shows just how ruthless the Roman Army and their Generals were. Kind of like, take no prisoners. Even the children were killed. Why? Because the Generals learned that when the kids grew up, they would want revenge.

There's a lot of action in Britannia and the Roman General in Britain is especially cruel. And smart.

For anyone who likes this time period, don't dwell too much on any perceived 'historical inaccuracies', just sit back and enjoy the ride. The opening music by Donnavan sets the mood. In part to me Britannia was both great and slightly crazy. Well worth your time.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14613,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2018-01-18","keywords":"soldier,roman army,roman conquest of britain,druid,female warrior","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0607375/","name":"David Morrissey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5732956/","name":"Eleanor Worthington-Cox","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0722279/","name":"Julian Rhind-Tutt"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165439/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050995/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125336/","name":"Jez Butterworth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125358/","name":"Tom Butterworth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0724597/","name":"James Richardson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Britannia: Ready","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3585458457","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJmZTFiNjUtYmI4MS00NzcwLTlmZDctNDkzYTc0Mzk3MjNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJmZTFiNjUtYmI4MS00NzcwLTlmZDctNDkzYTc0Mzk3MjNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Britannia: Ready"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 5932548, Title: Britannia, --- Description: Britannia: Created by Jez Butterworth, Tom Butterworth, James Richardson. With David Morrissey, Eleanor Worthington-Cox, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Liana Cornell. In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5932548/","name":"Britannia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmM2ZjA1NTAtZTBkNi00YmY2LTlhODItNWRlMmIxMzZjMjY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjkwOTAyMDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5932548/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jaybizman","dateCreated":"2020-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a look - First Series was, IMO, the best...","reviewBody":"I'll admit I love watching anything to do with Ancient Rome. As a teenager, I studied Lingua Latina and translated, for example, the writings of Julius Caesar and all the exploits throughout his career.

The Roman Army around 43AD was the most dangerous and skilled in the World; and Ancient Rome ruled most of what was the known World, they may lose a battle here and there, but rarely lost a war.

After every battle a Legions Commander would write about both his and the enemies tactics, and send a dispatch to the Sergeant Major Of The Army, back in Rome - who would copy same, and send it to every other Roman Legion General. This way every Commander had full knowledge of the enemy. And it worked.

Britannia shows just how ruthless the Roman Army and their Generals were. Kind of like, take no prisoners. Even the children were killed. Why? Because the Generals learned that when the kids grew up, they would want revenge.

There's a lot of action in Britannia and the Roman General in Britain is especially cruel. And smart.

For anyone who likes this time period, don't dwell too much on any perceived 'historical inaccuracies', just sit back and enjoy the ride. The opening music by Donnavan sets the mood. In part to me Britannia was both great and slightly crazy. Well worth your time.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14613,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2018-01-18","keywords":"soldier,roman army,roman conquest of britain,druid,female warrior","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0607375/","name":"David Morrissey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5732956/","name":"Eleanor Worthington-Cox","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0722279/","name":"Julian Rhind-Tutt"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165439/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050995/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125336/","name":"Jez Butterworth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125358/","name":"Tom Butterworth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0724597/","name":"James Richardson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Britannia: Ready","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3585458457","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJmZTFiNjUtYmI4MS00NzcwLTlmZDctNDkzYTc0Mzk3MjNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJmZTFiNjUtYmI4MS00NzcwLTlmZDctNDkzYTc0Mzk3MjNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Britannia: Ready"</script><metacontent="

In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5932548/","name":"Britannia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmM2ZjA1NTAtZTBkNi00YmY2LTlhODItNWRlMmIxMzZjMjY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjkwOTAyMDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5932548/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jaybizman","dateCreated":"2020-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a look - First Series was, IMO, the best...","reviewBody":"I'll admit I love watching anything to do with Ancient Rome. As a teenager, I studied Lingua Latina and translated, for example, the writings of Julius Caesar and all the exploits throughout his career.

The Roman Army around 43AD was the most dangerous and skilled in the World; and Ancient Rome ruled most of what was the known World, they may lose a battle here and there, but rarely lost a war.

After every battle a Legions Commander would write about both his and the enemies tactics, and send a dispatch to the Sergeant Major Of The Army, back in Rome - who would copy same, and send it to every other Roman Legion General. This way every Commander had full knowledge of the enemy. And it worked.

Britannia shows just how ruthless the Roman Army and their Generals were. Kind of like, take no prisoners. Even the children were killed. Why? Because the Generals learned that when the kids grew up, they would want revenge.

There's a lot of action in Britannia and the Roman General in Britain is especially cruel. And smart.

For anyone who likes this time period, don't dwell too much on any perceived 'historical inaccuracies', just sit back and enjoy the ride. The opening music by Donnavan sets the mood. IMDb data; ttnr: 5932548, Title: Britannia, --- Description: Britannia: Created by Jez Butterworth, Tom Butterworth, James Richardson. With David Morrissey, Eleanor Worthington-Cox, Julian Rhind-Tutt, Liana Cornell. In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5932548/","name":"Britannia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmM2ZjA1NTAtZTBkNi00YmY2LTlhODItNWRlMmIxMzZjMjY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjkwOTAyMDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 43 AD, the Roman Army returns to crush the Celtic heart of Britannia.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5932548/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jaybizman","dateCreated":"2020-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Worth a look - First Series was, IMO, the best...","reviewBody":"I'll admit I love watching anything to do with Ancient Rome. As a teenager, I studied Lingua Latina and translated, for example, the writings of Julius Caesar and all the exploits throughout his career.

The Roman Army around 43AD was the most dangerous and skilled in the World; and Ancient Rome ruled most of what was the known World, they may lose a battle here and there, but rarely lost a war.

After every battle a Legions Commander would write about both his and the enemies tactics, and send a dispatch to the Sergeant Major Of The Army, back in Rome - who would copy same, and send it to every other Roman Legion General. This way every Commander had full knowledge of the enemy. And it worked.

Britannia shows just how ruthless the Roman Army and their Generals were. Kind of like, take no prisoners. Even the children were killed. Why? Because the Generals learned that when the kids grew up, they would want revenge.

There's a lot of action in Britannia and the Roman General in Britain is especially cruel. And smart.

For anyone who likes this time period, don't dwell too much on any perceived 'historical inaccuracies', just sit back and enjoy the ride. The opening music by Donnavan sets the mood. In part to me Britannia was both great and slightly crazy. Well worth your time.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14613,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2018-01-18","keywords":"soldier,roman army,roman conquest of britain,druid,female warrior","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0607375/","name":"David Morrissey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5732956/","name":"Eleanor Worthington-Cox","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0722279/","name":"Julian Rhind-Tutt"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165439/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050995/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125336/","name":"Jez Butterworth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125358/","name":"Tom Butterworth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0724597/","name":"James Richardson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Britannia: Ready","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3585458457","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJmZTFiNjUtYmI4MS00NzcwLTlmZDctNDkzYTc0Mzk3MjNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJmZTFiNjUtYmI4MS00NzcwLTlmZDctNDkzYTc0Mzk3MjNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Britannia: Ready"</script><metacontent="

But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0307987/","name":"Bad Santa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4Njg1MDcwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzAxNjM3._V1_.jpg","description":"A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0307987/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dpolwatte"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad Santa (2003)","reviewBody":"An extreme end to christmas comedy genre. Characters are amazing. Style and film making is exceptional. Still it's a cinematic experience. And a fresh one at that.

It's innovative cinematic style that embeds Tarantino, Ritchie and many darkly comic film makers makes this a unique gem of a film.

Characters are amazing. Style and film making is exceptional. Still it's a cinematic experience. And a fresh one at that.

Overall - 3.5/5","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":140526,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-11-26","keywords":"christmas,christmas eve,heaving bosom,intercourse,stripper","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bad Santa: Blu-Ray","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3375209497","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA0M2EyMjktYmNlOS00MGQ1LTkzOTEtY2FiNGQ2OWM5M2Q4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA0M2EyMjktYmNlOS00MGQ1LTkzOTEtY2FiNGQ2OWM5M2Q4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bad Santa","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005170/","name":"Bernie Mac","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0334179/","name":"Lauren Graham"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959062/","name":"Terry Zwigoff"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114964/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275629/","name":"Glenn Ficarra","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0720135/","name":"John Requa"],"duration":"PT1H32M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Red Eye
Red Eye
programme.desc: Red Eye: Directed by Wes Craven. With Rachel McAdams, Cillian Murphy, Brian Cox, Laura Johnson. A woman is kidnapped by a stranger on a routine flight. Threatened by the potential murder of her father, she is pulled into a plot to assist her captor in a political assassination." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0421239/","name":"Red Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzAxNjc1ODczOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjE3MjEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman is kidnapped by a stranger on a routine flight. Threatened by the potential murder of her father, she is pulled into a plot to assist her captor in a political assassination.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0421239/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alancroydon"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well directed","reviewBody":"I had fun watching Red Eye. It's not a masterpiece, but it's well directed and structured. Cillian Murphy and Rachel McAdams are perfect in the role. Yes, it's the same old story with a different setting but Wes Craven gave it a good pace. At least not another Scream with the usual college killer. It's nice when you can see a clean, coherent thriller even when originality doesn't stand out as its main character. Particularly from a film-maker like Craven that has brought so many innovative ideas to the thriller and horror genre in the past and that now just lends himself to bringing home what could have been a good TV movie had it not been released theatrically. Good job!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116914,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-09-07","keywords":"psychotronic film,flight,hotel manager,hotel,airport","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Red Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi931332377","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBlNTVhYTYtOWFkYS00NzBlLWI2MmItMjExMTk2MWI1NGZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBlNTVhYTYtOWFkYS00NzBlLWI2MmItMjExMTk2MWI1NGZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1046097/","name":"Rachel McAdams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614165/","name":"Cillian Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004051/","name":"Brian Cox"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000127/","name":"Wes Craven"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044439/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013899/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0255296/","name":"Carl Ellsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1929257/","name":"Dan Foos"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

Christmas in Washington
programme.desc:
Christmas in Washington: Directed by Adrian Langley. With Natalie Lisinska, Damon Runyan, Kathleen Laskey, James Kall. Decorator Emily Barnes gets the gig of a lifetime decorating the Belmarian Embassy for the festive season. New ambassador Magnus Anderson has no time for the holidays. Emily shows Magnus how magical Christmas can be and sparks soon fly." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt14502376/","name":"Christmas in Washington","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjViODZjYTItNjRmMi00YjA4LTg4MmYtY2M2MDk4ZmFhYzhkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Decorator Emily Barnes gets the gig of a lifetime decorating the Belmarian Embassy for the festive season. programme.title: Smak Bożego Narodzenia
programme.desc: Szefowa kuchni i współwłaścicielka restauracji, Scarlett (Britt Irvin), otrzymuje od przyjaciela niezwykły prezent. Zostaje przez niego wysłana na kurs gotowania. Podczas zajęć kobieta poznaje na nowo tajniki swojego zawodu. Jednocześnie zyskuje szansę, by znaleźć miłość. Na horyzoncie pojawia się bowiem jej dawny znajomy.

programme.title: Biker Boyz
Pokonaj najszybszego
Biker Boyz
programme.desc:
Biker Boyz: Directed by Reggie Rock Bythewood. With Laurence Fishburne, Derek Luke, Orlando Jones, Djimon Hounsou. A son of the leader of a legendary group of an urban biker gang tries to retain his championship title." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0326769/","name":"Biker Boyz","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxNTY1NzA4MzJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU2MDQzMTMzNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A son of the leader of a legendary group of an urban biker gang tries to retain his championship title.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0326769/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob the moo"},"dateCreated":"2006-08-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Clunky dialogue, MTV visuals and average performances rob it of the potential shown by the very occasional good moment","reviewBody":"Kid is the son of Tariq aka "Slick Will", engineer to Smoke, who is the leader of the Black Knights motorcycle group and a legend on the streets. When Tariq is killed in a motorcycle accident, Kid drops off the scene for six months but returns determined to become more than just a prospect. His ultimate aim is to challenge Smoke himself and make his mark by taking down the biggest dog there is but first he must go legit and set up his own motorcycle gang with friends Stuntman and Primo.

Opening with a really nice tracking shot (or series of shots, I'm not sure) this film had my interest early on but very quickly blew it. With an obvious and predictable establishing scene, the narrative arch is established and thus I began my weary trudge from start to finish, through countless music video scenes, unconvincing dialogue scenes and loads of motorcycles. It is very basic stuff and it never aspires to much. The characters are cut out of cardboard and the dialogue is awful, this might cut the mustard if the film was an out and out action film but it isn't. Instead it is supposed to be a character driven film and thus it is a big problem for it to not have characters or convincing dialogue. Sadly it is a mess in regards the writing and plotting and only the forgiving will find the material worth two hours of their time.

The action is pretty weak. I didn't think any of the races were exciting and although they are well done, all of them could have sorely used the emotions of the characters to feed into them. As it is the failure of the plot means that much of the film is lacking and feels rather pointless. Occasionally it hints at depth and humanity but the occasional spark is totally drowned out in a sea of noise. The music video goals of the film are met but personally I'm glad not to be in the demographic sector that is tricked into thinking that this makes for a good film.

The cast are mixed, containing people that I expected better from and people that deserve stuff like this. Fishburne may well have expected more from the film because at times you can see him reaching, sadly he cannot achieve the impossible and any glimmer of a good performance is swamped. Luke struggles from the start. He is pretty and charismatic here but he can't deliver emotion and understanding that isn't in the script and his narration is terrible. The support cast are roundly average with obvious performances from Jones, Hounsou, Fehr and others. Good is sexy but pretty vacant while I'm not sure why Bonet bothered to turn up for so little.

Overall then a fairly pointless film that shrugs off any character potential it may have had in favour of MTV visuals, clunky dialogue and mostly average performances at best. You can see the potential in the story but across several aspects the film fails to deliver this potential and just churns out a totally unnecessary film that doesn't deserve any of your time."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13235,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-01-31","keywords":"motorcycle,african american,helmet,biker gang,rural setting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Biker Boyz","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1337590041","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5ZWIwZjYtZjdiOC00ZGEyLWE0NTktZDg2NTc4ZjVlZWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5ZWIwZjYtZjdiOC00ZGEyLWE0NTktZDg2NTc4ZjVlZWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1035682/","name":"Derek Luke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428963/","name":"Orlando Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0090066/","name":"Reggie Rock Bythewood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070636/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1213025/","name":"Michael Gougis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272948/","name":"Craig Fernandez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0090066/","name":"Reggie Rock Bythewood"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

Fishburne may well have expected more from the film because at times you can see him reaching, sadly he cannot achieve the impossible and any glimmer of a good performance is swamped. Luke struggles from the start. He is pretty and charismatic here but he can't deliver emotion and understanding that isn't in the script and his narration is terrible. The support cast are roundly average with obvious performances from Jones, Hounsou, Fehr and others. Good is sexy but pretty vacant while I'm not sure why Bonet bothered to turn up for so little.

Overall then a fairly pointless film that shrugs off any character potential it may have had in favour of MTV visuals, clunky dialogue and mostly average performances at best. You can see the potential in the story but across several aspects the film fails to deliver this potential and just churns out a totally unnecessary film that doesn't deserve any of your time.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13235,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-01-31","keywords":"motorcycle,african american,helmet,biker gang,rural setting","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Biker Boyz","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1337590041","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5ZWIwZjYtZjdiOC00ZGEyLWE0NTktZDg2NTc4ZjVlZWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5ZWIwZjYtZjdiOC00ZGEyLWE0NTktZDg2NTc4ZjVlZWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1035682/","name":"Derek Luke","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428963/","name":"Orlando Jones"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0090066/","name":"Reggie Rock Bythewood"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070636/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1213025/","name":"Michael Gougis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272948/","name":"Craig Fernandez","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0090066/","name":"Reggie Rock Bythewood"],"duration":"PT1H50M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hugo
Hugo i jego wynalazek
Hugo
programme.desc: Hugo: Directed by Martin Scorsese. With Ben Kingsley, Sacha Baron Cohen, Asa Butterfield, Chloë Grace Moretz. In 1931 Paris, an orphan living in the walls of a train station gets wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0970179/","name":"Hugo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzNzk5MzgyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTE4NDU5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1931 Paris, an orphan living in the walls of a train station gets wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0970179/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Balzer13"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Visually Stunning. The best 3D to date","reviewBody":"Saw it today in a sneak preview today at the Director's Guild in LA. James Cameron who was there professed it's a masterpiece and the best 3D to date. And he's right on both fronts. The film is exquisitely crafted. The cinematography and set design is likely going to take home a couple gold guys. It's a film lover's dream movie. As with many of Scorsese's films, it's an inspired film history lesson along side of being a dreamlike children's fable. A really unique combination that will work for the film enthusiasts and discerning family's with kids. Maybe a bit long for broad audiences with very little kids, but the images are so enchanting, it should win over most everybody. Sasha Baron Cohen is a brilliant and hilarious standout as the twitchy constable. It should be very well received just on the 3D alone."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":315454,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2011-11-23","keywords":"cinema,automaton,clock,mechanical man,memory","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2781978137","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzMzYwMzkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDM4OTU5Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzMzYwMzkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDM4OTU5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in 1930s Paris, an orphan who lives in the walls of a train station is wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton. programme.title: The Holiday
Ostatnie wakacje
Last Holiday
programme.desc:
The Holiday: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jude Law, Jack Black. Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0457939/","name":"The Holiday","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1MDk4MzA2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjQ3NDc3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0457939/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Redriter"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice~ very nice","reviewBody":"This was a really good, light hearted movie, with GREAT characterization. There are points where the movie is a little slow, but not slow enough to loose your interest.

All of the characters are wonderfully developed especially Jude Laws-the under-story of Jude's character adds an extra dimension to his character and really makes you love him all the more.

Kate Winslet's character is another that was well worked out. She helps out this little old man . . . and the character development between her and this older gentleman is wonderful . . . it adds so much to her character, makes her more human, more real, someone very likable and someone you want to end up with a good ending.

Jack Black's character was sweet, not corny . . . and you end up liking him very much. He was not a goober like he usually is in his movies.

Over all, it was a wonderfully character driven movie, that was enjoyable and had you leaving the theater feeling good. I recommend it highly!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":272438,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-12-13","keywords":"kiss,film composer,english countryside,cottage,book editor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Holiday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3321037081","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wrongfully Accused
Ściągany
Wrongfully Accused
programme.desc:
Wrongfully Accused: Directed by Pat Proft. With Leslie Nielsen, Richard Crenna, Kelly LeBrock, Melinda McGraw. Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man after escaping from a bus accident on the way to jail." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120901/","name":"Wrongfully Accused","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGI5NWUwNmItZDBmZS00Yjg5LWE0ZWMtMjAzYmVlNWIwMmEzL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man after escaping from a bus accident on the way to jail.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120901/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"OllieSuave-007"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nielsen does it again!","reviewBody":"Leslie Nielsen returns with another hilarious spoof, this time starring as violinist Ryan Harrison, who is framed for murdering Hibbing Goodhue. He needs to find a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man to get to the truth of the crime, all the while trying to hide from the pursuing authorities.

As with any Nielson spoofs, there are non-stop gags from start to finish that will have you horse-laughing. Slapstick humor is abundance here, but did get a little old in a plot where the momentum didn't flow as quick as Nielsen's earlier spoof movies like the Naked Gun films. However, the slapstick humor is done tastefully in a way that is doesn't get borderline annoying (i.e., forced comedy).

The characters are calm and serious as always in their demeanor, especially Nielson, spoofing his "The Fugitive" character well. Stars Wars, Titanic, Back to the Future and Anaconda are among the many movies hilariously spoofed - all giving us another entertaining and laughable comedy.

Grade B-","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":24974,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1998-07-23","keywords":"satire,satirical,sex,violin,one legged man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Wrongfully Accused","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979580697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzdkN2VmZjktYzRhZC00NDQ5LWJkMTItMWY3NjJmZDA2YTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzdkN2VmZjktYzRhZC00NDQ5LWJkMTItMWY3NjJmZDA2YTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000558/","name":"Leslie Nielsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001077/","name":"Richard Crenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001456/","name":"Kelly LeBrock"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698493/","name":"Pat Proft"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698493/","name":"Pat Proft"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Precious
Push
programme.desc:
Precious: Directed by Lee Daniels. With Gabourey Sidibe, Mo'Nique, Paula Patton, Mariah Carey. In New York City's Harlem circa 1987, an overweight, abused, illiterate teen who is pregnant with her second child is invited to enroll in an alternative school in hopes that her life can head in a new direction." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0929632/","name":"Precious","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3NDM4ODMwNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTYyNDIzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In New York City's Harlem circa 1987, an overweight, abused, illiterate teen who is pregnant with her second child is invited to enroll in an alternative school in hopes that her life can head in a new direction.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0929632/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Matt_Layden"},"dateCreated":"2010-09-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life is hard. Life is short. Life is painful. Life is rich. Life is....Precious.","reviewBody":"This is a film that might make some people a little uneasy. It deals with family abuse in the form of rape, physical and verbal violence. The one character it follows is Precious, an overweight illiterate teenage girl who is pregnant with her second child from her biological father. She is kicked out of her school because of her pregnancy and is enrolled in another educational institution called each one teach one. She wants to do better things, but doesn't have the will or motivation because of the constant abuse at the hands of her mother. She day dreams about being a big star and getting out of the hellish life she lives.

The film is raw with the material and doesn't really hold any punches. Lee Daniels second feature film shows vast improvement over the messy Shadowboxer starring Cuba good Jr. His grasp of the material and dedication to have the story be told is evident in his attention to translate the novel to screen. Daniels has put together a cast that care about the subject matter and the story as much as he does and is surrounded by the talent that is needed to pull it off. 

Gabourey Sidibe is Precious, the troubled teen wanting more out of life. She shines in her first starring role and it's no walk in the park for her. The role demanded talent and Sidibe delivers what is needed. Of course the one who stands out the most is Mo'Nique earning herself a much deserved Oscar for her role as the abusive and sloth ridden mother. Her confrontation with her daughter after the birth of the second child is intense and will have you holding your breath in fear for the safety of the child. 

Precious is a film that is driven by a strong story and an emotional cast that cares about the work they are doing. It's a glimmer of hope that keeps the story moving in a world that is hard edged and usually leads nowhere. It's not a relatively long film, but I did find myself checking my watch every now and then and some bits in the film happen without much clarification. Where did that one white boy come from in her Each One Teach One class? In any event, the final product is a good film with a message about hope and Tyler Perry finally has his name attached to something good in his career (Star Trek not included).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":108913,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-11-20","keywords":"lesbian couple,lesbian,f rated,self narration,mother daughter conflict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Precious: Based on the Novel Push by Sapphire -- Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1522402585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MTg2OTA3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA3MDAyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjk0MTg2OTA3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA3MDAyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Harlem, an overweight, illiterate teen (Sidibe) who is pregnant with her second child is invited to enroll in an alternative school in hopes that her life can head in a new direction."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2829737/","name":"Gabourey Sidibe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0594898/","name":"Mo'Nique"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1745736/","name":"Paula Patton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200005/","name":"Lee Daniels"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048235/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0223834/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2819316/","name":"Geoffrey Fletcher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2497119/","name":"Sapphire"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
Assassin's Creed
programme.desc:
Assassin's Creed: Directed by Justin Kurzel. With Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons, Brendan Gleeson. Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2094766/","name":"Assassin's Creed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzE1OTczNTc1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgyMDI3MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2094766/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rinette"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very Enjoyable","reviewBody":"I have not played the Assassin's Creed games. However, this movie did not make me feel as though I needed to have played them in order to understand or enjoy the film.

The cinematography was great, and there were some magnificent aerial views of 15th century Spain along with modern day. Michael Fassbender and Marion Cotillard both gave excellent performances, managing to deliver the occasional corny, melodramatic dialogue with poise, and the supporting cast were equally great in their roles. Despite the occasional cheese, this film had some excellent dialogue that were thoughtful and poignant - unexpected in a fantasy action movie! Speaking of action - this was the best part of the movie. Gorgeous choreography, and I loved all the various weaponry and free running.

This is by no means an award winning film, but overall it was incredibly enjoyable, and I don't think it quite deserves the negativity critics and fans of the games are giving it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":193925,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-12-28","keywords":"based on video game,assassin,secret society,spain,spanish inquisition","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1056093721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, he discovers he is a descendant of the secret Assassins society."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1055413/","name":"Michael Fassbender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182839/","name":"Marion Cotillard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000460/","name":"Jeremy Irons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0997291/","name":"Justin Kurzel"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109033/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2078681/","name":"Michael Lesslie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177836/","name":"Adam Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171651/","name":"Bill Collage"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Heartbreak Kid
Dziewczyna moich koszmarów
The Heartbreak Kid
programme.desc: The Heartbreak Kid: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Ben Stiller, Malin Akerman, Michelle Monaghan, Jerry Stiller. A newly wed man who believes he's just gotten hitched to the perfect woman encounters another lady on his honeymoon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0408839/","name":"The Heartbreak Kid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExNTM2NTE2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTI5MDUzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A newly wed man who believes he's just gotten hitched to the perfect woman encounters another lady on his honeymoon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0408839/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mheron-2"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great comedy !","reviewBody":"The Farrely Brothers did it again ! One more good comedy for their list. I don't understand people saying this film is bad, cruel or something. This film is great, has a lot of funny moments, terrific cast and a rocking soundtrack. Who wants more than 1 hour and a half of pure fun, laughs and weird moments. The story is simple: Eddie (Ben Stiller) is a bachelor who finds what seems to be the perfect girl. He marries her only to find that she's a living nightmare. Later, he meets another girl and wind up falling in love with her. That's where the fun begins when he gets into a terrible mess with his wife and his new affair. The film is not politically correct, but fun don't have to be correct. Fun is fun and is meant to make you laugh and the film truly deliver the goods. If you are too moral about wedding, loyalty, good manners, please don't see this movie cause you probably will not like it. The ending really surprised me. I thought it was going to be something like sweet and warm. Instead, we have a real life, non-moral type of ending."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89705,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2007-11-21","keywords":"marriage,dysfunctional marriage,sporting goods store,resort,humorous sex scene","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Heartbreak Kid","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3220373785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODRhYWFlZTYtMGViYS00OWUyLThkMDktYzI5N2NmM2U5Y2QzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODRhYWFlZTYtMGViYS00OWUyLThkMDktYzI5N2NmM2U5Y2QzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Clip: Mariachi Band"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157358/","name":"Michelle Monaghan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0015196/","name":"Malin Akerman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035905/","name":"Scot Armstrong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228908/","name":"Leslie Dixon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Clueless: Directed by Amy Heckerling. With Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy, Paul Rudd. programme.title: Wrongfully Accused
Ściągany
Wrongfully Accused
programme.desc:
Wrongfully Accused: Directed by Pat Proft. With Leslie Nielsen, Richard Crenna, Kelly LeBrock, Melinda McGraw. Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man after escaping from a bus accident on the way to jail." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120901/","name":"Wrongfully Accused","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGI5NWUwNmItZDBmZS00Yjg5LWE0ZWMtMjAzYmVlNWIwMmEzL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man after escaping from a bus accident on the way to jail.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120901/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"OllieSuave-007"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nielsen does it again!","reviewBody":"Leslie Nielsen returns with another hilarious spoof, this time starring as violinist Ryan Harrison, who is framed for murdering Hibbing Goodhue. He needs to find a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man to get to the truth of the crime, all the while trying to hide from the pursuing authorities.

As with any Nielson spoofs, there are non-stop gags from start to finish that will have you horse-laughing. Slapstick humor is abundance here, but did get a little old in a plot where the momentum didn't flow as quick as Nielsen's earlier spoof movies like the Naked Gun films. However, the slapstick humor is done tastefully in a way that is doesn't get borderline annoying (i.e., forced comedy).

The characters are calm and serious as always in their demeanor, especially Nielson, spoofing his "The Fugitive" character well. Stars Wars, Titanic, Back to the Future and Anaconda are among the many movies hilariously spoofed - all giving us another entertaining and laughable comedy.

Grade B-","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":24974,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1998-07-23","keywords":"satire,satirical,sex,violin,one legged man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Wrongfully Accused","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979580697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzdkN2VmZjktYzRhZC00NDQ5LWJkMTItMWY3NjJmZDA2YTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzdkN2VmZjktYzRhZC00NDQ5LWJkMTItMWY3NjJmZDA2YTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000558/","name":"Leslie Nielsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001077/","name":"Richard Crenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001456/","name":"Kelly LeBrock"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698493/","name":"Pat Proft"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698493/","name":"Pat Proft"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zoolander
Zoolander
programme.desc:
Zoolander: Directed by Ben Stiller. With Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Christine Taylor, Will Ferrell. At the end of his career, a clueless fashion model is brainwashed to kill the Prime Minister of Malaysia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0196229/","name":"Zoolander","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODI4NDY2NDM5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzEwOTMxMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the end of his career, a clueless fashion model is brainwashed to kill the Prime Minister of Malaysia.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0196229/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2007-07-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny For Those Who Like Absurd Humor","reviewBody":"This has to be a movie that people would either laugh their butt off watching, or turn it off and never finishing it because it was so stupid. Fortunately, as someone who loves absurd humor, I was entertained by it. Yes, it's one of the dumbest films you'll ever see, but it's supposed to be stupid, a satire on the shallow people and world of male fashion models.

Ben Stiller is outstanding as "Derek Zoolander," the brainless model who's number one male model status is upended by newcomer "Hansel," played by Owen Wilson. In light of Wilson's recent real-life drug problems, I couldn't help but think "how can these actors play absurd roles like this and be normal?" It's almost understandable by so many in the film business are whacked! You have to hand it to them, though: Stiller, Wilson, Millo Jovovich and Will Ferrell are good at playing weird people, as they do here. But it's all in fun - plus a serious comment about child labor - and the movie is simply to be enjoyed for what it is. Of course, it's stupid overall, but it's a spoof, like the Austin Powers films.

Film fans and celebrity geeks will enjoy all the cameos in here, along with the wild outfits - male and female - and all the goofy looks on the faces, mainly Stiller's poses. In between all the dumbness is some smart satire on several topics dealing with the fashion business. Just know what you are getting into here, and you should get enough laughs to make it an entertaining hour-and-a-half.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":256401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-02-27","keywords":"male model,fashion model,conspiracy,fashion,malaysia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005562/","name":"Owen Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852132/","name":"Christine Taylor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045189/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0766153/","name":"Drake Sather"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357453/","name":"John Hamburg"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0196229, Title: Zoolander, --- Description: Zoolander: Directed by Ben Stiller. With Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Christine Taylor, Will Ferrell. At the end of his career, a clueless fashion model is brainwashed to kill the Prime Minister of Malaysia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0196229/","name":"Zoolander","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODI4NDY2NDM5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzEwOTMxMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the end of his career, a clueless fashion model is brainwashed to kill the Prime Minister of Malaysia.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0196229/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1","dateCreated":"2007-07-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny For Those Who Like Absurd Humor","reviewBody":"This has to be a movie that people would either laugh their butt off watching, or turn it off and never finishing it because it was so stupid. Fortunately, as someone who loves absurd humor, I was entertained by it. Yes, it's one of the dumbest films you'll ever see, but it's supposed to be stupid, a satire on the shallow people and world of male fashion models.

Ben Stiller is outstanding as "Derek Zoolander," the brainless model who's number one male model status is upended by newcomer "Hansel," played by Owen Wilson. In light of Wilson's recent real-life drug problems, I couldn't help but think "how can these actors play absurd roles like this and be normal?" It's almost understandable by so many in the film business are whacked! You have to hand it to them, though: Stiller, Wilson, Millo Jovovich and Will Ferrell are good at playing weird people, as they do here. But it's all in fun - plus a serious comment about child labor - and the movie is simply to be enjoyed for what it is. Of course, it's stupid overall, but it's a spoof, like the Austin Powers films.

Film fans and celebrity geeks will enjoy all the cameos in here, along with the wild outfits - male and female - and all the goofy looks on the faces, mainly Stiller's poses. In between all the dumbness is some smart satire on several topics dealing with the fashion business. Just know what you are getting into here, and you should get enough laughs to make it an entertaining hour-and-a-half.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":256401,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-02-27","keywords":"male model,fashion model,conspiracy,fashion,malaysia","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005562/","name":"Owen Wilson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852132/","name":"Christine Taylor"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045189/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0766153/","name":"Drake Sather","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0357453/","name":"John Hamburg"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stardust
Gwiezdny pył
Stardust
programme.desc: Stardust: Directed by Matthew Vaughn. With Ian McKellen, Bimbo Hart, Alastair MacIntosh, David Kelly. In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0486655/","name":"Stardust","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkyMTE1OTYwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIxODYzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0486655/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dave_wright87"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most fantastical adventure of the year!","reviewBody":"I went into this film with modest hopes, the director had pedigree, I had seen Charlie Cox in Casanova and was impressed, and literally EVERYONE had been raving about it. As the story started to unfold I was introduced to Victorian England on one side of a mysterious Wall, and on the other a magical land, Stormhold. The actual plot weaves together many strands and I don't want to ruin the surprises for anyone, but at the barest it is the simple tale of a young man (Charlie Cox) in love with the village beauty (Sienna Miller). To win her love he tells her he will fetch back a fallen star from the other side of the Wall. Howver when he arrives at the star he finds not a lump of astral metal as he expected but a beautiful woman (Claire Danes). As the two journey back to the wall they find themselves in the adventure of a lifetime. The visuals are brilliant, England looks stunning, in a similar fashion to New Zealand in LOTR, and it s full of wonderful little flourishes, such as the way that the star shines when she is happy, a very simple effect, but one that looks radiant. As well as this the acting good, especially from the leads and Robert DeNiro, whose turn as the captain of an airship is incredibly memorable. This film is THE perfect date movie, it is romantic without being a "chick flick", funny and full of wonderful action pieces that will satisfy any action film fan. All in all it is a truly magical experience from beginning to end, and I now Im raving about it to EVERYONE!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2007-10-24","keywords":"witch,magic,transformation,shooting star,one word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stardust","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4018471193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1214435/","name":"Charlie Cox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165404/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0325567/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0963359/","name":"Jane Goldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301274/","name":"Neil Gaiman"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Daddy's Home
Tata kontra tata
Daddy's Home
programme.desc:
Daddy's Home: Directed by Sean Anders. With Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Linda Cardellini, Thomas Haden Church. Brad Whitaker is a radio host trying to get his stepchildren to love him and call him Dad. But his plans turn upside down when their biological father, Dusty Mayron, returns." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1528854/","name":"Daddy's Home","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0OTE1MTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM5OTk5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Brad Whitaker is a radio host trying to get his stepchildren to love him and call him Dad. But his plans turn upside down when their biological father, Dusty Mayron, returns.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1528854/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jtindahouse"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Has its moments but it's no game-changer","reviewBody":"'Daddy's Home' is the second collaboration between Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg, the first being 2010's 'The Other Guys'. There's no doubt the two have chemistry. What there is doubt about is how to perfectly utilise each of the two as characters. The problem is that for Wahlberg's confident, in-charge character (which he has to play) to work Ferrell needs to play the straight guy and that isn't when he's at his best. He does it well there's no doubt about it, but he's at his best when his character has an edge to him like 'Ron Burgundy' or his character in 'Step Brothers'. Playing the overly straight guy just seems almost a waste for the one Ferrell movie we get a year, even though no one could deny he still does it very well. 

The difference in quality between this and 'Get Hard' is noticeable. There, Kevin Hart was unable to find a chemistry with Ferrell and it just turned into the two competing with each other trying to make the movie their own. Here that's not the case. Wahlberg seems happy to let Ferrell take the reins and is comfortable just doing what he does best, with his laid back, dry sense of humour accompanying Ferrell perfectly. 

There are consistent laughs throughout, but perhaps not one stand out scene that will be memorable for years to come. It doesn't push the envelope as much as other Ferrell movies have in the past either. I really would love to see him always be given free rein to say and do as he pleases but also understand why that can't always be the case. If you're just looking to get your annual fix of a bit of Ferrell hilarity then you won't be disappointed. If you are looking for a game-changer, perhaps wait for the next one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":115615,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2015-12-30","keywords":"sweat,pull,pull ups,push,muscle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1706799641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzM0NjMzMzAzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQwMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzM0NjMzMzAzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQwMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mild-mannered radio executive strives to become the best stepdad to his wife's two children, but complications ensue when their freewheeling and freeloading real father arrives, forcing him to compete for the affection of the kids."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004802/","name":"Linda Cardellini"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0325207/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186190/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0122602/","name":"Brian Burns"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1898234/","name":"John Morris"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
Mr. & Mrs. Smith
programme.desc:
Mr. & Mrs. Smith: Directed by Doug Liman. With Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn, Adam Brody. A bored married couple is surprised to learn that they are both assassins hired by competing agencies to kill each other." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0356910/","name":"Mr. & Mrs. Smith","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxMzcxNzQzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzQxNjUyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bored married couple is surprised to learn that they are both assassins hired by competing agencies to kill each other.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0356910/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"carljessieson"},"dateCreated":"2010-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining as Hell!","reviewBody":"This is a daaaamn fun movie! Heh. To all the critics, yes, there are a lot of explosions, gunfire, unrealistic battles, plenty of times where you think "they MUST have been hit by a bullet by now..there is noo effin way...", and over-dramatized violence, but there's plenty of good stuff too that should not be ignored.

Probably the best part about this movie is the couple. I know it's been said before, but it's so true that I'm gonna repeat: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie have incredible chemistry. It's no wonder they're still together today. Even when the movie couple, John and Jane Smith, where in their "off period" of marriage, you could feel something between the two. They are an amazing screen couple, they work incredibly well together. Their dialogue is just right...when one says something to the other, it's smooth and real. And of course, Pitt and Jolie are both extremely attractive, so they're fun to watch. Haha.

The plot is all right..nothing extraordinary. It's a typical action movie plot, simple enough to leave plenty of room for the battle shots and violence. Nothing special. The dialogue wasn't bad, it wasn't lame action movie words. No stupid puns or anything. There was really nice cinematography, some shots that really were stunning. Usually the emotional aspect of action movies is dense and easy, cliché and boring, but I liked it in this movie. You could tell that they really loved each other, yet at the same time were committed to their jobs. You could feel the conflict.

I own this movie and I'm glad I do. It's a good time. I recommend it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":473361,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2005-06-08","keywords":"secret agent,character names as title,desert,surname in title,wife hits husband","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mr. and Mrs. Smith","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2627141913","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjIyNjItZTFkMy00M2IwLTkxNjItNmM1YjQ2YzM1OWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjIyNjItZTFkMy00M2IwLTkxNjItNmM1YjQ2YzM1OWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001401/","name":"Angelina Jolie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111013/","name":"Adam Brody"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093488/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1334526/","name":"Simon Kinberg"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0356910, Title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith, --- Description: Mr. & Mrs. Smith: Directed by Doug Liman. With Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn, Adam Brody. A bored married couple is surprised to learn that they are both assassins hired by competing agencies to kill each other." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0356910/","name":"Mr. & Mrs. Smith","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxMzcxNzQzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzQxNjUyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bored married couple is surprised to learn that they are both assassins hired by competing agencies to kill each other.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0356910/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"carljessieson","dateCreated":"2010-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining as Hell!","reviewBody":"This is a daaaamn fun movie! Heh. To all the critics, yes, there are a lot of explosions, gunfire, unrealistic battles, plenty of times where you think "they MUST have been hit by a bullet by now..there is noo effin way...", and over-dramatized violence, but there's plenty of good stuff too that should not be ignored.

Probably the best part about this movie is the couple. I know it's been said before, but it's so true that I'm gonna repeat: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie have incredible chemistry. It's no wonder they're still together today. Even when the movie couple, John and Jane Smith, where in their "off period" of marriage, you could feel something between the two. They are an amazing screen couple, they work incredibly well together. Their dialogue is just right...when one says something to the other, it's smooth and real. And of course, Pitt and Jolie are both extremely attractive, so they're fun to watch. Haha.

The plot is all right..nothing extraordinary. It's a typical action movie plot, simple enough to leave plenty of room for the battle shots and violence. Nothing special. The dialogue wasn't bad, it wasn't lame action movie words. No stupid puns or anything. There was really nice cinematography, some shots that really were stunning. Usually the emotional aspect of action movies is dense and easy, cliché and boring, but I liked it in this movie. You could tell that they really loved each other, yet at the same time were committed to their jobs. You could feel the conflict.

I own this movie and I'm glad I do. It's a good time. I recommend it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":473361,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2005-06-08","keywords":"secret agent,character names as title,desert,surname in title,wife hits husband","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mr. and Mrs. Smith","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2627141913","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjIyNjItZTFkMy00M2IwLTkxNjItNmM1YjQ2YzM1OWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2NjIyNjItZTFkMy00M2IwLTkxNjItNmM1YjQ2YzM1OWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001401/","name":"Angelina Jolie","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111013/","name":"Adam Brody"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093488/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1334526/","name":"Simon Kinberg"],"duration":"PT2H"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Passengers: Directed by Rodrigo García. With Anne Hathaway, Patrick Wilson, Andre Braugher, Dianne Wiest. A grief counselor working with a group of plane-crash survivors finds herself at the root of a mystery when her clients begin to disappear." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0449487/","name":"Passengers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3ODE5MjIzMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTc4Nzc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A grief counselor working with a group of plane-crash survivors finds herself at the root of a mystery when her clients begin to disappear.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0449487/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"christine_devries"},"dateCreated":"2009-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting, thought-provoking movie...","reviewBody":"I liked this movie. I like the whole, 'elemental humanity' that you find in it. It is possible to identify with the characters and the universality of the movie. It really is a bit of a psychological thriller which I like. The only thing is that, after watching it, you may get a little depressed. The ending is completely unexpected, I must say. It made the movie completely worth it, when at times it would just get really confusing out of no where. I definitely thought it was worth seeing. I love movies that invoke an emotional response. The twists and turns will keep you guessing and you may get more out of it than you expected. Happy watching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36214,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Mystery","Romance","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2008-09-26","keywords":"airplane crash,survivor,explosion,afterlife,doctor patient relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Passengers: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3525836825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM5NDQ0Njk2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2OTkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM5NDQ0Njk2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2OTkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first theatrical trailer for Passengers, directed by Rodrigo GarcÃ­a."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933940/","name":"Patrick Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001556/","name":"David Morse"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006554/","name":"Rodrigo García"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142446/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0123049/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0159892/","name":"Ronnie Christensen"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="
